message.content:
cs.DB, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with worst-case bounds for the size of the result of a conjunctive query to a database given an arbitrary set of functional dependencies. This topic is closely related to database theory and information theory, which are both subfields of computer science. Therefore, cs.DB and cs.IT are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also uses tools from linear programming and provides insights into the entropy structure of worst-case instances, which are topics in optimization (cs.DS) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses a polynomial time algorithm for distinguishing whether the result of a query can be any larger than the input database, which is a topic in computational complexity (cs.CC).
